 Overview: 
 
  ECG, the most experienced healthcare consulting firm working in the U.S., is ranked as a Best Small Firm to Work For 2024 by Consulting Magazine. At ECG, our primary emphasis is on quality—in our people as well as our services—and we’re seeking others who appreciate our high standards of excellence.
 


 What’s in It for You: Work with Purpose


  At ECG, you can have a bigger impact than you ever imagined. The work you do will ultimately help health systems deliver care more effectively and efficiently—and that’s just the beginning. We’re looking for innovators, problem-solvers, and self-starters to collaborate, take on challenging projects, and find new ways to improve processes. ECG is committed to ensuring a supportive work environment that embraces DEI, recognizes performance, communicates transparently, and values work/life balance.
 


 Join Our Analytics Hub


  Our growing Analytics Hub works with our consulting teams to deliver new insights, streamlined analysis, and world-class intelligence to the healthcare organizations we serve as clients. Combined with our consulting teams, you will be helping physician and executive leadership make informed decisions that can alter the course of their enterprises in areas such as physician alignment, mergers and acquisitions, service line planning, provider compensation, financial performance, transforming care models, patient access, managed care portfolio optimization, digital health expansion, and more. ECG uses a Microsoft Azure and Microsoft 365 environment, with Microsoft Power BI as ECG’s current analytics visualization platform. The goal of the position is to further capitalize on the existing ECG infrastructure, as well as implement new features and technologies. The ideal candidate is open to new challenges, exceptional at multitasking, and proficient at implementing new solutions.
 


 Our detailed plans incorporate qualitative findings with data-driven strategic, operational, and financial considerations that enable organizations to pursue realistic change. Our consultants bridge the gap between strategic thinking and operational implementation with sensible action plans and tactical recommendations. This approach allows us to stretch our clients’ thinking while ensuring that initiatives with the broadest and deepest impact are prioritized and implementable. Our wide-ranging engagements often focus on helping our clients:
 

Position themselves for value-based care delivery.
Align hospitals and physician organizations.
Strengthen financial performance.
Enhance clinical programs.
Develop strategic partnerships and/or mergers.



 Your Opportunity with ECG: Senior Data Analyst


  As a senior data analyst, you will support the firm’s client delivery and business development efforts, working with consultants and senior leaders to manage large data sets, aggregate internal and external data, develop scalable models and other analyses, and support data visualization and presentation sets. In addition, the analyst will work directly with our internal support teams (IT, business development, and L&D) and associated vendors for data management and IT solutions and will assist with a range of innovative analytic opportunities. Here, no two days or projects are alike, which means you’ll have a lot to learn and plenty of support to help you succeed.
 


 Your Responsibilities May Include:


Gathering and synthesizing data from various sources (e.g., national surveys, proprietary research, client interviews, industries, markets)
Preparing analyses related to hospital inpatient databases and provider claims data
Building flexible, dynamic, and scalable financial and operational models to forecast trends, preparing scenarios for consulting efforts related to delivery and business development (e.g., strategic planning, operational improvement, market assessments)
Enhancing existing models and capabilities built using SQL, primarily, with some use of Python or R in certain models or scenarios
Performing complex analyses on big data, including cleaning, preparing, and interpreting
Identifying and executing analyses in response to consultant business intelligence inquiries
Building relational databases using a Microsoft SQL Server or Fabric
Communicating market insights to pursuit teams, and supporting business development efforts
Configuring, maintaining, and building flexible reports, queries, and visuals within the Power BI environment and the production and development environments of related databases
Researching, testing, and implementing solutions in Power BI
Partnering with various consulting units (strategy, academic health, provider financial services, performance transformation, etc.) to gather requirements related to data analytics
Developing, configuring, and maintaining interfaces to exchange data among Power BI, SQL databases, and other cloud-based applications
Creating and maintaining analytical support documentation and operating procedures
Developing new and innovative methodologies and approaches
Contributing to internal education and learning opportunities for consultants and operations members for the Analytics Hub and analytics in general, and supporting education about ECG’s use cases related to analytics in work
Assisting the director of data analytics in developing analytics and data strategy to support data analytics capabilities at the firm


 Our Expectations of You

Strong knowledge of and passion for the healthcare industry
A bachelor’s degree in either computer science, computer engineering, mathematics, statistics, health information management, health administration, business, or a related degree that relies heavily on critical thinking, logic, and math
Five years of healthcare data analytics work experience using databases, SQL, and Power BI required
Prior experience in healthcare consulting preferred
Experience using Python, R, Fabric, and Tableau
Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
Comfort with manipulating and synthesizing large data sets
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Excellent organizational skills



 Job Locations


  Chicago, Seattle, and Washington, DC. This position has in-office responsibilities. Must be able to work a hybrid schedule with days in the office and days remote.
 


 Schedule


  Full time/exempt
 


 What You Can Expect of Us


  To reward our driven, innovative, and passionate employees, we’ve built a company culture that’s centered on performance. We offer an attractive compensation package, challenging work, and an entrepreneurial environment where you can take ownership of your career—and get out as much as you put in.
 


 The estimated base salary range for this job is $100,000 - $130,000 annually. It represents a good faith estimate of the range that ECG reasonably expects to pay at the time of the job posting. The actual salary paid will vary based on multiple factors, including but not limited to years of experience, special skills, and market changes. This job is eligible to participate in ECG's annual incentive compensation program, which reflects ECG's pay-for-performance philosophy. The job is also eligible to participate in ECG’s benefit plans, which include medical, dental, and vision coverage, unlimited PTO, and other wellness programs.
 


 About ECG


  With knowledge and expertise built over the course of 50-plus years, ECG is a national consulting firm that is redefining healthcare together with its clients. ECG offers a broad range of strategic, financial, operational, and technology-related consulting services. ECG is an industry leader, offering specialized expertise to hospitals, health systems, medical groups, academic medical centers, children’s hospitals, ambulatory surgery centers, investors, and payers/health plans. As an affiliated partner of Siemens Healthineers, ECG’s subject matter experts have a proven track record of delivering results fueled by top talent and technology. ECG’s national presence includes offices in Atlanta, Boston, Chicago, Dallas, Minneapolis, San Diego, Seattle, St. Louis, and Washington, DC.
 


 Apply now and make an impact for years to come.


  To begin the recruitment process, please submit your resume via our career site at https://careers.ecgmc.com.
 


 ECG provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to sex, race, color, religion, national origin, citizenship, ancestry, age, disability, pregnancy, medical condition (cancer and genetic characteristics), genetic information, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, military or veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristic. People of color are encouraged to apply. We participate in E-Verify as part of our onboarding process. Having the permanent legal right to work in the United States is a condition of employment. ECG is not currently able to provide assistance to candidates requiring sponsorship or a visa.

Overview

  Join a dynamic Customer Success (CS) Data and Analytics team that leverages analytics and AI to improve customer experiences and transform Intuit’s journey to becoming an industry leader. We are seeking a seasoned Staff Business Data Analyst with a passion for delivering data-driven insights, demonstrated leadership, and the ability to drive complex projects. This role will partner closely with Product Managers, stakeholders, and cross-functional teams to develop data-driven solutions and deliver meaningful business outcomes at scale. Additionally, this role will work closely with our Virtual Expert Platform (VEP) organization to drive innovations that connect customers with experts in real time.
 

 What you'll bring

7-10+ years of experience in data and analytics, with strong leadership in data architecture and strategy.
Advanced proficiency in SQL, “big data” technologies (e.g., Redshift, Spark, Hive, BigQuery), and BI tools (e.g., Tableau, Qlik, Dash).
Extensive experience with AI/GenAI tools for automating tasks and building custom implementations.
Strong communication and project management skills with the ability to lead cross-functional teams and deliver successful outcomes.
Experience designing and executing A/B tests and using data to drive business insights and innovation.



 How you will lead

Data-Driven Insights: Lead complex, cross-functional projects to deliver actionable insights that support decision-making and business outcomes.
Conversation Capabilities: Analyze and measure the effectiveness of conversation platforms such as chat, voice, and video, providing recommendations to enhance customer engagement.
AI/GenAI Solutions: Partner with AI teams to integrate AI/GenAI capabilities that improve business processes and drive key outcomes.
Data Architecture & Quality: Oversee data architecture, design, instrumentation, and quality initiatives across business units, ensuring alignment with strategic objectives and robust data systems.
Business Intelligence (BI) & Testing: Utilize advanced BI tools and frameworks to drive insights and recommendations, and design A/B testing to evaluate business strategies.
Mentorship & Leadership: Guide junior analysts and influence senior leaders by delivering compelling data stories, recommendations, and scalable solutions for critical business initiatives.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with business partners to develop and implement data-driven strategies and tools that align with company goals.

Diversity - Innovation - Caring - Global Collaboration - Winning Spirit - High Performance


      At Boston Scientific, we’ll give you the opportunity to harness all that’s within you by working in teams of diverse and high-performing employees, tackling some of the most important health industry challenges. With access to the latest tools, information and training, we’ll help you in advancing your skills and career. Here, you’ll be supported in progressing – whatever your ambitions.
     

About the role:
The Senior Data Analyst will be responsible for developing and maintaining analytics, reports, and data modeling to support the Spencer Materials department.

This role will link existing tools and data sources across programs and Materials functions to create a consistent data analytics development and deployment strategy within Spencer Materials. The role requires collaboration with local, regional, and global business partners as well as Boston Scientific IT teams to build, optimize, and monitor the foundational data assets in a dynamically changing environment to support business initiatives through descriptive, diagnostic, predictive, and prescriptive analytics.


Your responsibilities will include:


Interacts with internal customers and across multiple functions to determine customer data or report requirements and translates them into reports for analysis.
Collects and tracks data and provides analysis through ongoing reporting, ad hoc analysis and partnership to share insights and ensure understanding within the business.
Uses data to depict or highlight key organization trends. Collaborates with businesses to identify insights, trends and potential opportunities, interventions, and solutions to demonstrate business value.
Develops and maintains analytical tools used by the business. Identifies and recommends opportunities to optimize system and reporting. May maintain relationships with data and software vendors.
Assists with the development and communication of the data analytics strategy and operating plan.
Design automated reporting to support efficient standard work by stakeholder partners.
Partner with data architecture team to establish data pipelines to enable transition off excel/manual based processes and align with enterprise data strategies.
Work collaboratively with our business partners at varying levels to identify current pain points, troubleshoot, and design analytical solutions considering current business processes, systems, and data by enabling consumption through PowerBI.
Lead technical support for key dashboards & reports including data infrastructure.
Deliver excellent customer support through core team involvement in projects requiring system data and technical understanding.
Monitor information systems for opportunities to improve efficiency and accuracy and make recommendations for implementation of new systems or necessary upgrades that will best meet customer and company requirements.
Drive processes to ensure data integrity and consistency across SAP, Rapid Response, MES, HANA, and other supporting systems.
Ensure that appropriate training is provided on the analytics solutions being delivered to ensure appropriate usage.
Lead complex projects that implement critical business analytics solutions.
Act as a coach in the further refinement of the analytics self-service project.
Engage in complex corporate projects, tasks, and timelines to ensure Spencer is represented and aligned.
May lead multiple project activities simultaneously where prioritization skills are critical.
Engaged in the team’s Lean Business Process objectives to provide continuous improvement.
Calculate and track return on investment for implemented projects, as well as for future projects to enable prioritization.




Required qualifications:


Bachelor’s degree in Analytics, Computer Science, or similar technical degree.
5+ years of analytics or related experience
3+ years of experience with advanced analytic techniques
Experience with big data programming languages and ETL technologies (i.e. Python, SQL, AWS Athena, Alteryx, Tableau Prep etc.).
Experience with PowerQuery and PowerBI.
Experience managing data analytics implementation and reporting projects.
Experience implementing highly technical solutions in a manner accessible to less technical end users.




Preferred qualifications: 


Analytical with strong problem-solving and critical thinking skills; process-driven.
Experience with Agile and Lean methodologies.
Experience with operating cloud data warehouses or data lake (e.g., Snowflake, AWS).
Experience with Supply Chain (Purchasing, Planning, Warehousing, Logistics).
Organized with effective project management skills; ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects.
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams in a virtual setting.
The job may require 5-10% travel to visit BSC manufacturing sites, conferences, and flexible schedule to accommodate multiple time zones.
Experience with data science and predictive analytics.
English/Spanish Bilingual

  Analytic Partners is a global leader in commercial measurement and optimization, turning data into expertise for the world’s largest brands for almost 25 years.
 



  Our holistic approach to decisioning is powered by our industry-leading platform and team of experts, who help leaders make better decisions, faster – unlocking business growth and creating powerful customer connections.
 



  With clients in 50+ countries and global offices across New York City, Miami, Dallas, Dublin, London, Paris, Singapore, Shanghai, Munich, Sydney, Melbourne, Charlottesville and Denver, we’re growing fast. And we’re looking for top talent to join us in shaping the future of analytics.
 



  To learn more about what we do, visit analyticpartners.com, and see why we’re recognized as a leader by The Forrester Wave™: Marketing Measurement & Optimization, Q3 2023 Report.

What you’ll be doing: 

Collect and analyze data related to consumer behavior, market trends, and campaign performance. Using proprietary tools and techniques to prep, mine and format customer data, analyze, produce models to develop insight dashboards and customer presentations.
Develop and maintain statistical models that predict consumer behavior, campaign performance, and other key metrics.
Collaborate as part of a team to drive analyses and insights, walking customers through dashboards and developing narratives that explain results and aid in more informed decisions and improved business performance.

 What we look for in you:

Bachelor’s degree or above (ideal areas of study: Business Analytics and Management, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, and/or Marketing)

Strong working knowledge of Microsoft PowerPoint and Excel
You demonstrate analytical principles, strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

Experience using data to solve business questions and drive business solutions.
You bring strong written and verbal communication appropriate for a professional work environment.

We bring together multi-disciplinary, highly skilled technical teams to deliver high-quality system solutions and services that deliver business value. The Sr Principal IT Data Analyst (Data Solution Partner) with rich experience building Data Centric Solutions is a key role on the team, enabling science by leading and contributing to full software lifecycle; architecture, design, implementation, testing and deployment of Scientific Data Applications that add demonstrable value and impact to the scientific operations of Research & Pre-clinical Development (R&pD) functions at Regeneron. You will be an integral team member to leverage our data platform, working closely with other team members as well as our scientists to organize/manage/transform our biology data in a way to enable our scientists to gain scientific insights easier and faster. You will also contribute to design and implement the cross functional data solution including visualization platform to serve research data/information/knowledge to our scientists in a user-friendly fashion. Our current Data Platform Tech stack includes Spotfire, Spark, Python, AWS EMR, AWS MWAA, AWS Redshift, AWS RDS Postgres Aurora, Dremio. As a Sr Principal IT Data Analyst, a typical day may include the following:  Collaboration with Data SMEs and Scientists to improve data models, increasing data accessibility and promoting data-driven decision making  Hands-on Technologist with skill to design, develop and maintain scalable data solution for new Data Product & support continuing increases in data volume and complexity  Defining and driving adoption of best practices in Data Solution & Architecture  Defining Data models & building Data product pipeline as script in PySpark  Performing data analysis required to troubleshoot data related issues, root cause analysis and assisting with resolution of data issues  Driving unification of Reference, Category, and Master Data to increase Data Quality.  Acting as an expert technical resource for Data Application Solution  Maintaining strong expertise and knowledge of current and emerging technologies and products; evaluating AWS Services, Opensource & Vendor tools and implementing new technologies  Mentoring on approach and execution of solutions, coaching on technologies, and establishing a team-wide comprehension of solution capabilities and direction  This May Be the Right Role for You If you: Continuously identify opportunities for improving processes and solutions, including the consolidation of similar security needs.  Collaborate with the team to implement technical best practices, policies, and procedures.  Have ability to lead training initiatives, demonstrating a capacity to educate teams.  Have excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.  Excellent verbal and written communication skills, and ability to effectively interact with all personnel, ability to work autonomously and in groups, highly organized, deadline-oriented, continuous-improvement mindset.  Ability to develop and maintain highly effective relationships and influence others to achieve goals. To be considered for this role, you must have an advanced degree in Biology and/or advanced degree in Computer Science. 3+ years of Data pipeline development experience with Spark (PySpark), Redshift, & Airflow or other data platform technologies. 5+ years of SQL experience & No-SQL experience. 5+ years of experience with schema design and dimensional data modeling. 3+ years of Data Lake, Datawarehouse & BI Tools (Spotfire preferable) experience. Deep biology knowledge and experience in managing biology data is a must. Experience working on Big Data Platform (EMR & Hadoop preferable) of any size/scale. Ability in managing and communicating BI, Big Data, Data Lake, Datawarehouse concepts to different stakeholders. Experience inspiring software development teams. Demonstrable skill in collaborating with other IT teams, vendor partners, internal collaborators, and architects to deliver solutions; advocacy for a DevOps approach to the software development lifecycle. Solid understanding of the practical application of Agile development methods and leading software development teams in an Agile/Lean/Continuous Delivery environment. Ability to formulate and articulate the technical and political implications of creating and delivering transformative technical solutions in an innovative, high-growth, demanding business area. Experience working directly with senior IT leaders in an advisory role on technical strategies. Interest in and experience mentoring junior developers and driving technical discussions and decisions.  Responsibilities: 
 
  For over 25 years, Noblis has provided specialized engineering, acquisition, and program management services to the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA), playing a key role in the acquisition and implementation of mission-critical systems and capabilities across the Air Traffic Organization (ATO) and the Office of NextGen (ANG). We are seeking passionate and committed professionals ready to contribute their expertise towards advancing the National Airspace System (NAS) in alignment with the FAA's forward-looking vision for aviation. As part of our team, you'll have the opportunity to contribute to projects that streamline the acquisition and deployment of next-generation air traffic management and surveillance systems, improve infrastructure at airports and in the airspace, and support the integration of unmanned aircraft systems and commercial space ventures. Your work will directly influence the FAA's ability to adapt to future growth and technological shifts, ensuring the aerospace system remains the safest and most efficient worldwide.
 


 Come and be a part of our dynamic team, where your contributions will not only advance the aviation industry but also contribute to a safer, more sustainable future in air travel. Apply now and take flight towards a rewarding career that promises growth, innovation, and collaboration at the forefront of aviation technology.
 


 Description


  Noblis is seeking Aviation Data Analysts to support the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) Air Traffic Systems and Surveillance Services directorates within the Program Management Organization (PMO). Employees will provide services related to managing and analyzing aviation-related data to improve operational efficiency, safety, and decision-making processes in the National Airspace System (NAS).
 


 Responsibilities


Review aviation-related information to assist in decision-making about flight routes, spending practices, employee efficiency, safety, and aviation regulations, including national security.
Use data to make predictions and estimations related to all aspects of aviation.
Perform operational analysis and develop concepts of operations.
Analyze architecture, overall systems design, concepts of operations, and implementation plans.
Conduct research and analysis that meets quality standards on focused, structured questions.
Apply standard, routine, and well-established analytic methodologies to produce logical, traceable, objective, and unbiased analysis.
Collect data, create metrics, and perform associated analyses.
Query databases using SQL and classify and summarize data for the preparation and submission of reports.
Clearly document and review standard operating procedures, policies, event reports, best practices, and lessons learned.
Effectively communicate technical and non-technical data to various audiences.
 Required Qualifications: 
 
Successfully pass an FAA background investigation/verification and receive a successful final suitability determination.
Ability to construct effective briefings using MS PowerPoint and intermediate to advanced skills with MS Word and Excel.
Proficiency in analyzing, interpreting, summarizing, and presenting data effectively.
Skilled in programming (R or Python), statistics, SQL, data visualization, and other data analysis fundamentals.
Experience applying data analytic methods (Statistical Analysis, Predictive Modeling, Time Series Analysis, Geospatial Analysis, and Data Visualization) in an operational environment.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.


 Educational and Experience Requirements





  Work experience that is not relevant to the labor category definition will not be considered in the "Years of Relevant Experience" calculation.

5 years of relevant experience may be substituted for the bachelor’s degree.

PhD in related field may be substituted for bachelor’s degree and 7 years’ experience.

PhD in related field may be substituted for bachelor’s degree and 7 years’ experience.

 Junior-level


Minimum of 2 years’ experience with Bachelor’s degree in any field.
5 years of relevant experience may be substituted for the bachelor’s degree.

PhD in related field may be substituted for bachelor’s degree and 7 years’ experience.
Compensation Ranges - Oklahoma: $50,400 - $126,970
 Desired Qualifications: 
 
Advanced degree in Mathematics, Data Science, Business Analytics, Statistics, Computer Science, or Information Systems.
Experience designing and implementing sustainable Business Intelligence solutions(e.g., Tableau, Power BI, D3.js) in an operational environment.
Experience with Big Data technologies and platforms such as Apache Hadoop, Apache Spark, and NoSQL Databases for the storing, processing and managing of large structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data sets.
Ability to work both independently and as part of a team; Proactive, solution-oriented, with exceptional time management skills.
FAA experience highly desired.





 Locations may vary depending on location of the project. Some primary on-site locations include: Washington D.C., Egg Harbor NJ, and Oklahoma City OK.
   




 Possibility of some roles allowing for remote/hybrid employment.
   




 All roles require U.S. citizenship or green card permanent resident who has resided in the U.S. for 3+ years

 Overview: 
 
  Noblis and our wholly owned subsidiaries, Noblis ESI, and Noblis MSD tackle the nation's toughest problems and apply advanced solutions to our clients' most critical missions. We bring the best of scientific thought, management, and engineering expertise together in an environment of independence and objectivity to deliver enduring impact on federal missions. Noblis works with a wide range of government clients in the defense, intelligence and federal civil sectors. Learn more at Noblis -About Us

        Established in 1997, L.A. Care Health Plan is an independent public agency created by the state of California to provide health coverage to low-income Los Angeles County residents. We are the nation’s largest publicly operated health plan. Serving more than 2 million members, we make sure our members get the right care at the right place at the right time.  Mission: L.A. Care’s mission is to provide access to quality health care for Los Angeles County's vulnerable and low-income communities and residents and to support the safety net required to achieve that purpose.





           Job Summary
          


The Business Insights Data Analyst III is a key contributor responsible for supporting short and long-term operational and/or strategic business initiatives in the healthcare sector. This position navigates the complexities of healthcare data. This position encourages a dynamic and innovative mindset, emphasizing the importance of thinking outside the box. Independently navigates and analyzes data sources to derive meaningful insights. As part of the essential duties, this role involves extensive experience in data visualization, utilizing tools to translate complex datasets into visually compelling and easily understandable presentations. This position provides weaving narratives that communicate actionable insights to diverse stakeholders.


           Furthermore, the Business Insights Data Analyst III collaborates in a highly matrixed environment with senior leaders, management, and line staff is essential. This position serves as a mentor to team members, leveraging analytics proficiency to drive successful outcomes. Acts as a Subject Matter Expert, serves as a resource and mentor for other staff.
          





           Duties
          


 Technical Excellence and Systematic Analysis: Completes work in a technical and systematic manner, applying standard formulas and methods prevalent in the healthcare industry.
Collects, manipulates, and analyzes data with precision, ensuring adherence to industry standards and relevance to current data trends.

Statistical Analysis and Modeling: Utilizes correlation analysis techniques to expose potential drivers in outcomes. Deploys statistical process controls to identify observations (e.g., providers, time-periods) which require additional special cause investigation. Determines and implements case-appropriate multivariate modeling techniques, such as basic regression and clustering.

Report Preparation and Visualization: Prepares detailed reports, utilizing a variety of visualizations such as graphs, charts, and dashboards effectively communicating significant results derived from data analysis. Collaborates with cross-functional teams to ensure reports align with business objectives and provide actionable insights.

Influential Communication and Project Leadership: Influences senior leadership, management, and line staff through compelling recommendations generated from data analysis. Drives initiatives to completion within a highly matrixed environment.

Adaptive Responsibilities: Conducts root cause analysis to identify underlying issues and drive effective solutions, leveraging data insights to address systemic problems. Adapts to evolving healthcare business and processes, demonstrating the ability to pivot and quickly learn new industry concepts and practices.

Applies subject expertise in evaluating business operations and processes. Identifies areas where technical solutions would improve business performance. Consults across business operations, providing mentorship, and contributing specialized knowledge. Ensures that the facts and details are correct so that the project’s/program's deliverable meets the needs of the department, organization and legislation's policies, standards, and best practices. Provides training, recommends process improvements, and mentors junior level staff, department interns, etc. as needed.


           Performs other duties as assigned.
          





           Duties Continued
          






           Education Required
          



           Bachelor's Degree in Healthcare Analytics or Related Field
          

           In lieu of degree, equivalent education and/or experience may be considered.
          





           Education Preferred
          






           Experience
          



 Required: Minimum 4 years of collecting, manipulating, and analyzing data in business and/or healthcare
          

           Minimum of 4 years of SQL experience, leveraging big data for complex analyses.
          

           Extensive experience with data visualization using Tableau.
          

           Proven experience in independently managing multiple priorities, including researching conflicting and/or inaccurate data to ensure data integrity and reliability.
          

Preferred Experience in the healthcare industry.
          





           Skills
          



 Required Proven hands-on experience with relational databases, including Oracle or SQL Server, and expertise in comprehensive data management and analytics platforms such as Cloudera.
          

           Ability to articulate sophisticated analyses, trends, and strategic opportunities to clients and stakeholders through powerful data storytelling.
          

           Strong interpersonal skills for effective engagement with management at various levels of the organization, including demonstrated ability to manage projects and initiatives.
          

 Preferred Strong proficiency in Python or R programming, showcasing the ability to harness advanced analytics and automation in data-driven initiatives.

Summary  Posted: Sep 20, 2024  Weekly Hours: 40  Role Number:200569138  Do you love thinking analytically? Are you passionate about using your financial knowledge to navigate complex challenges? Just as our customers find value in Apple products, the Finance group finds value for both Apple and its shareholders. As part of this group, you’ll play an integral role in ensuring our day-to-day financial health. You and your team will support Apple’s growth, both top and bottom line, by applying the same level of innovation toward financial matters as we do toward our products and services. You’ll also collaborate with Apple teams across the world to develop more effective investment strategies and risk management. Finance is essential to upholding our global commitment to excellence, and it is directly responsible for shaping the company’s future. Join us, and you’ll have a meaningful role in continuing Apple’s legacy of efficiency and success. We’re looking for a Sr Analyst to join the Strategy & Planning team and contribute to our mission of scaling Wallet and Apple Pay into new and exciting markets, establishing organizationally effective practices and removing obstacles. The primary responsibility of this role will be assisting in development of the annual and quarterly operating plans with a focus on budget and headcount resourcing. This is a chance to put your own slant on things, show creativity around the financial metrics to track performance and to report to Wallet and Payments leadership team.  Description  Apple is seeking a highly proficient Financial Analyst to support the Wallet & Payments Strategy organization. This role will be responsible for finance-related activities including managing and forecasting operation expenses requiring a deep understanding of business as well as positive relationships with key partners. Responsibilities include reconciling multiple data universes, identifying discrepancies, managing solutions, supporting other critical deliverables including quarter-end deep-dive analytics. This role will also collaborate cross-functionally across a globally distributed group to meet the data needs of the business and translate those needs into analytical requirements. 
 
6yrs of experience working as a data/business analyst or related role
Proficient with SQL, big data systems and tools and Tableau dashboard design, development and publishing
Bachelor Degree in Business, Finance or related field
  Preferred Qualifications

Strong financial competence; FP&A experience, Advanced Excel, SAP
Ability to work with large amounts of data and see the ‘bigger picture’
Critical thinking: able to look at numbers, trends, and data and come to new conclusions based on the findings
Demonstrated strong organizational skills with attention to detail and ability to work with ambiguity and uncertainty
  Pay & Benefits

  At Apple, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. This provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role. The base pay range for this role is between $115,100 and $216,900, and your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location.  Apple employees also have the opportunity to become an Apple shareholder through participation in Apple’s discretionary employee stock programs. Apple employees are eligible for discretionary restricted stock unit awards, and can purchase Apple stock at a discount if voluntarily participating in Apple’s Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You’ll also receive benefits including: Comprehensive medical and dental coverage, retirement benefits, a range of discounted products and free services, and for formal education related to advancing your career at Apple, reimbursement for certain educational expenses - including tuition. Job Description




      The New York City Department of Investigation (DOI) is one of the oldest law enforcement agencies in the country with a mission of combating municipal corruption. It serves the people of New York City by acting as an independent and nonpartisan watchdog for New York City government, City agencies, and City employees, vendors with City contracts, individuals and entities that receive City funds.  DOI's Office of the Inspector General for the New York City Police Department (OIG-NYPD) is authorized to investigate, review, study, audit and make recommendations relating to the operations, policies, programs and practices of New York Police Department (NYPD), with the goal of enhancing effectiveness, increasing public safety, protecting civil liberties and civil rights, and increasing the public's confidence in the police force.  DOI's OIG-NYPD is seeking an Associate Data Analyst who will supervise at least one data analyst while supporting active investigations into the operations, policies, practices and programs of the NYPD.   In this role the Associate Data Analyst will:  

Develop and enhance data practices for generating investigative leads through patterns and trends related to the operations, policies, programs, and practices of the NYPD.
Develop and implement data harvesting, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality, and oversee the work of those conducting the analysis.
Acquire data from primary or secondary sources and maintain databases/data systems.
Develop quality assurance systems for data and manage processes to ensure data quality.
Develop strategies to utilize machine learning to enhance the work of OIG-NYPD.
Perform complex statistical analyses of sample and aggregate data sets to identify patterns, trends, and systemic issues.
Work as an advisor on systemic and individual investigations into the practices of NYPD.
Develop new methods for collecting data, new database applications for archiving and retrieval of statistics, and maintenance of records.
Develop error checking programs to determine if the data collected is reliable, timely, and valid.
Create and maintain databases, while preparing data sets for statistical analysis, including data cleaning and formatting.
Communicate clearly and effectively through compelling reports, presentations, and visualizations.
Conduct data related interviews connected to systemic and individual investigations.
Conduct policy assessments, memos and external correspondence.
Create data graphics.
Determine the preservation method of datasets and files related to the analytical work conducted for systemic and individual investigations.
 If selected, the candidate will be fingerprinted and undergo a background investigation. In addition, for positions that have a law enforcement and/or investigative function, the candidate's consumer credit history will be reviewed during the background investigation, and as otherwise permitted by NYC Administrative Code 8-107(24)(b)(2)(A).
     
 Minimum Qualifications
 1. A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college or university and four years of data processing experience; two years of which must have been in internal control/quality assurance or computer science.  2. Education and experience equivalent to "1" above.
 Preferred Skills - Master’s degree or advanced coursework in computer science, information systems or related field. - Strong analytical, written and verbal communication skills. - Experience using statistical modeling techniques to analyze policy research questions related to social policy, policing, and government. - Advanced knowledge of Excel and extensive experience with and proficiency in statistical computing software or data analytic environments (e.g., SAS, SPSS, Stata, SQL/NoSQL databases including ETL, Python, R, Tableau), including the ability to analyze large and complex datasets for patterns and trends, and build statistical models. Preference will be given to those with additional experience with geographical mapping software like ArcGIS. - Knowledge of one or more data visualizations tools such as i2 Analyst Notebook, Cognos, Tableau, R libraries, D3.js and SAS. - Knowledge and experience with statistical and datamining concepts such as significance testing, regression, decision trees, clustering, forecasting, sampling, and scenario analysis. - Be familiar with Big Data platforms and Cloud tools data mining, data cleaning, data warehousing and structures and one or more RDBMS systems. - High proficiency in sampling techniques. - Excellent analytical, verbal, and written communication skills and ability to translate complex, technical information for colleagues and consumers who have nontechnical backgrounds. - Knowledge of, and demonstrated interest in, criminal justice, law enforcement, police accountability, and/or civil rights issues - Excellent organization and time management skills. - Superb judgment. - Ability to exercise discretion on sensitive or confidential matters. - Familiarity with NYPD policies, procedures, operations and regulations and New York City government a plus. - Thorough when performing work and conscientious about attending to detail.
 Public Service Loan Forgiveness As a prospective employee of the City of New York, you may be eligible for federal loan forgiveness programs and state repayment assistance programs. For more information, please visit the U.S. Department of Education’s website at https://studentaid.gov/pslf/.
 Residency Requirement New York City residency is generally required within 90 days of appointment. However, City Employees in certain titles who have worked for the City for 2 continuous years may also be eligible to reside in Nassau, Suffolk, Putnam, Westchester, Rockland, or Orange County. To determine if the residency requirement applies to you, please discuss with the agency representative at the time of interview.

THE COMPANY


  KRAFTON is dedicated to identifying and publishing games worldwide that offer a uniquely enjoyable experience, crafted by our globally recognized production studios known for their distinctive creativity. We continuously push the boundaries of gaming enjoyment by embracing new challenges and technologies and expanding our platforms and services to captivate an even larger fan base. Best known for the genre-defining worldwide sensation PUBG: Battlegrounds, our stellar studios based across the globe include PUBG Studios, Striking Distance Studios, Unknown Worlds, Bluehole Studio, RisingWings and more. In collaboration with our passionate and driven team, we strive to establish ourselves as a renowned creator of masterpieces in the global gaming market.
 



THE OPPORTUNITY


   We are seeking a Senior Data Analyst with over 7 years of experience in data analytics, business intelligence, and reporting. The ideal candidate will lead comprehensive data analysis projects, collaborate with senior stakeholders, and develop advanced analytics solutions that support strategic decision-making. They will be responsible for mentoring a team of analysts, driving process improvements, and ensuring data quality and integrity. Additionally, this role will involve building high-impact dashboards, leveraging data mining techniques to uncover trends, and presenting actionable insights to senior leadership to inform business strategies.
  

 RESPONSIBILITIES



    Lead comprehensive data analysis projects, managing the entire process from data extraction to advanced statistical modeling and insightful reporting.
   

    Collaborate with senior stakeholders to define strategic business questions and deliver actionable insights that inform key business decisions.
   

    Develop and optimize high-impact dashboards that monitor key performance indicators and provide clear visibility into business health.
   

    Leverage advanced data mining techniques to uncover trends and forecast business opportunities that support strategic decision-making.
   

    Mentor and guide a team of analysts, fostering a culture of continuous learning, technical growth, and excellence.
   

    Drive process improvements and automation within the analytics pipeline, increasing efficiency and scalability.
   

    Present complex data insights to senior leadership, offering clear recommendations that shape strategic initiatives.
   

    Collaborate with IT and data engineering teams to ensure an optimized data infrastructure for efficient access and analysis.
   


QUALIFICATIONS



    7+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a related field, with a proven ability to lead data-driven initiatives.
   

    Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Data Science, or a related discipline, with a commitment to continuous learning and staying up-to-date with industry trends.
   

    Expertise in SQL for extracting, manipulating, and analyzing large, complex datasets, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
   

    Proficiency in data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or equivalent platforms, with a demonstrated ability to create intuitive and actionable dashboards.
   

    Strong understanding of statistical methods, including data modeling, forecasting, and predictive analytics, with practical experience applying these techniques to business problems.
   

    Ability to translate complex business requirements into clear, actionable insights that inform strategic decisions.
   

    Excellent communication skills, with the capacity to present data-driven insights to both technical and non-technical audiences effectively.
   

    Proven organizational and project management skills, with a track record of successfully managing multiple concurrent projects.
   


PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS



    Experience working in global companies or gaming companies.
   

    Experience with cloud-based data platforms (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud, Azure) or big data technologies, with a focus on optimizing data access and infrastructure for analytics.
   

    Knowledge of machine learning or AI applications in data analytics.
   

    Familiarity with Python or R for data analysis and automation.
   

    Experience contributing to company-wide data strategies.
   

    Proficiency in Korean to effectively communicate with teams and stakeholders in Korea.

PURPOSE OF THE POSITION:
The Financial Data Analyst is responsible for ensuring the integrity of accounting information by recording, verifying, reporting, and entering transactions. This position serves as the reporting analyst for the finance team and prepares routine and ad-hoc reports using various business intelligence tools. The position is responsible for the timely and accurate reporting of freight expense, fruit price variance, raw product handling, and supply price variance. This position serves as a business partner for the supply chain department by providing guidance on financial management, reporting, inventory control and various explanations. The Financial Data Analyst is expected to improve business processes and tools to enhance Tree Top productivity and customer service by gathering business requirements, identifying opportunities within the business structure, and implementing systematic improvements. In addition, the position assists in the preparation of the budget for freight expense, fruit price variance, raw product handling, and supply price variance.
 WORKING RELATIONSHIPS:
This position reports to the Sr. Financial Analyst and does not supervise staff. The position works closely with information services, accounting, sales and marketing, customer service, supply chain, and operations.
 QUALIFICATIONS FOR ENTRY:
 KNOWLEDGE OF:

Understanding and working knowledge of GAAP
Principles and practices of financial and manufacturing accounting.
Principles and practices of financial forecasting and budgeting.
Pertinent Federal, State, and local laws, codes, and regulations.

 ABILITY TO:

Manage confidential and sensitive information.
Participate on cross-functional project teams that investigate, analyze, and recommend process improvements.
Maintain confidential and sensitive information.
Identify, research, and analyze problems, identify alternative solutions, and project consequences of proposed actions.
Accustomed to investigating to fully understand (a) how operational responses impact financial results and (b) how process flow effects the ability to mine relevant data. Make relevant recommendations in both instances.
Effectively organize, plan, and execute.
Use computers and computer software including ERP systems, Business Intelligence systems, SQL, and Excel to perform routine ad-hoc tasks.
Meet behaviors established in Tree Top's performance management and development process.

 EXPERIENCE, CERTIFICATION/LICENSES, AND TRAINING:

A bachelor's degree in accounting or finance or 5 years of relevant experience in lieu of a degree.




Concentration in Information Systems preferred.



Preferred 3 years of relevant experience with exposure to financial accounting, analysis, and reporting.
Experience working with and analyzing big data, has experience in efficiently organizing and compiling user-friendly reports.
Experience working with ERP systems (Infor preferred but not required), advanced Excel skills, experience with business intelligent tools and/or SQL.

The ideal candidate will be highly skilled in all aspects of data analytics, including mining, generation, and visualization. The candidate will be detail-oriented and adept at communicating with a range of audiences. Additionally, this person should be committed to transforming data into readable, goal-oriented reports that drive innovation and growth.
Objectives of this role
· Develop, implement, and maintain analytics systems.
· Identify trends and opportunities for improvements in program efficiencies or support through analysis of datasets.
· Create best-practice reports with pertinent data visualizations, based on mining and analysis of data received.
· Evaluate internal systems for efficiency, problems, and inaccuracies, and develop and maintain protocols for handling, processing, and cleaning data.
· Work directly with users to gather requirements, provide status updates, provide customer service support, and build relationships.
· Onboard new users to analytic systems and in-house data products.
Responsibilities
· Work closely with project managers to understand and maintain focus on their analytics needs, including critical metrics and KPIs, and deliver actionable insights to relevant decision-makers.
· Proactively analyze data to answer key stakeholder questions, including investigating which areas need programmatic improvement and making recommendations.
· Identify the data for retrieval and create specialized reports using that data.
· Develop and maintain rich interactive visualizations through data interpretation and analysis.
· Develop and maintain databases and improve data evaluation process to more efficient and scalable across datasets.
· Provide innovative suggestions on improving data collection methods and standardizing data input.
· Develop user guides and training materials (related to the data products and tools developed by the team) for the analytics systems and participate in user training programs. Training and training materials
· Provide customer service support and provide recommendations for improving the user interface and experience.
· Participate in cross-functional teams and working groups as part of stakeholder engagement.
Required skills and qualifications
· Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) in mathematics, computer science, economics, or statistics.
· Three or more years of experience mining data as a data analyst.
· Proven analytics skills, including mining, evaluation, and visualization.
· Technical writing experience in relevant areas, including queries, reports, and presentations.
· Strong SQL or Excel skills, with aptitude for learning other analytics tools.
· Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with multiple and shifting priorities.
· Experience in delivering high-quality products of both quantitative and qualitative nature for a range of audiences. Data collected will be both quantitative and qualitative. Candidates should be able to produce briefs and reports that analyze both types of data. Qualitative data would be data coming from the DOE labs, plants, or sites about their emergency management programs, such as gaps they identified in their emergency management programs.
· Proven success in a collaborative, team-oriented environment.
· Excellent customer service experience.
· Superior attention to detail and accuracy.
Preferred skills and qualifications
· Experience with database and model design and segmentation techniques.
· Strong programming experience with frameworks, including XML, JavaScript, and ETL.
· Practical experience in statistical analysis using statistical packages.
Security Clearance
· Active Top Secret or Q clearance preferred.
· The selected candidate must be able to obtain and maintain a Q clearance.
Candidate’s Location
· Preferred location is the Washington, DC metro area.

Hybrid consisting of remote and potential support at a DOE facility.

At Duke Health, we're driven by a commitment to compassionate care that changes the lives of patients, their loved ones, and the greater community. No matter where your talents lie, join us and discover how we can advance health together.
 About Duke Health Technology Solutions
Pursue your passion for caring and innovation with Duke Heath Technology Solutions, which is dedicated to the transformation, development, and management of enterprise information technology solutions across Duke Health. By harnessing the power of innovative technologies like cloud computing and artificial intelligence — and pairing them with a forward-thinking approach — Duke Health Technology Solutions is revolutionizing the future of health care at Duke Health and beyond.
 POSITION DESCRIPTION
 Job Title: 3844- DHTS IT Analyst - Business / Systems Analyst

 Primary Role: This position reports to the DHTS-Data Partnerships Director of Data and Analytics Platforms. This individual will be primarily responsible for IT Service Management, System Compliance and Platform Lifecycle Management of the Duke Data Hub platform (data lake) and Federated Clinical Analytics Platform (FCAP) and drive the sourcing of new data modalities into those platforms.
The candidate should be skilled in ITIL service, incident, problem, and change management, creating and maintaining system documentation in support of audit and compliance reviews, and managing requirements and development team activities in the creation of quality solutions.
The Business / Systems Analyst will be a member of a Data Engineering Scrum team that is delivering solutions focused on using state of the art cloud data and analytics tools including traditional and near real-time data warehousing, big-data, relational and document-based databases using both extract, load, transform (ELT) toolsets as well as REST APIs and FHIR.

Essential Tasks/Responsibilities

Document all platforms and configurations, and execute system reviews and test plans as required by internal and external compliance and audit groups
Evaluate Duke clinical systems that hold data that are desired to be included in the platforms and work with the application owners and the solutions architect to design and document the data flows and required compliance documentation to perform extracts of the data
Translate service requests and incidents entered by our partners and internal customers into work items and track those work items to completion
Manage change requests through the DHTS change management process coordinating with cross functional groups through the build, test, and implementation phases
Support the Data Partnerships QA team to ensure high quality in delivered products and services


 Education: Bachelor's degree in a related field, or four years of equivalent technical experience required

 Required Experience: We are looking for a candidate with 5+ years of experience in a BUSiness / Systems Analyst role who has the following experience:

Experience in Healthcare IT
Experience in exploring, diagraming, and documenting systems integrations
Intermediate working SQL knowledge and experience working with a variety of RDBMSs
Working in an agile development team in delivering multiple complex solutions; preferably using the Scrum Framework
Using an application lifecycle management platform for managing development team work, such as Azure Boards, ServiceNow, GitLab
Creating system documentation, release notes, and testing documentation in support of regulated solutions
Performing root cause analysis on internal and external processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement
Supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment
Strong project management and organizational skills


 Desired Skills: 

Azure Cloud certifications
Working experience with the FHIR specification

Overview
As a Senior Data BSA/Product Associate on the Transactional Data Products team within Enterprise Data and Analytics, you will drive the ingestion and integration of core data domains to be leveraged by Business Intelligence and Advanced Analytics teams to gain insights on successes and opportunities. You will propel analytics through robust data comprehension, requirement mapping, data modeling, and cross-functional partnership. With this diverse role, areas of potential focus range from (1) data architecture design to direct business process evolution, (2) backlog prioritization and management, (3) reverse engineering to understand and evolve an existing solution, (4) researching a critical source system/service to automate ingestion, and (5) educating teammates on your robust knowledge of business data requirements and business process. This role will be vital in shaping the landscape by which analytics teams interact with and leverage data, as each release broadens available data sets and expands analytics self-serve capabilities.
Beyond these core competencies it will be very important for this candidate to be comfortable working with remote data science professionals. This assignment will be working specifically to support the recent Acquisition of Celect and onboarding them to existing data products as well as eliciting requirements to build new ones.
If youre right for this role, youre a data evangelist with hands-on SQL experience, agile product experience and a basic understanding of data architecture. In your daily work, you actively seek the most effective path forward, and are insistent on progress. You are equally comfortable working in a relational data store and a big data cloud eco-system. To you, the importance of value-based solutioning, incremental progress, and failing fast is clear, and you can demonstrate how each of these helps to drive business results. You enjoy finding relationships between disparate data sets and clarity in a muddied data environment. When it is time to simplify a complex technical idea onto a white board for a non-technical audience, you want the pen in your hand.
Not Available

 Overview: 
 
  Cotiviti is currently looking to add an industry leading Data & Insight Analyst who is focused on architecting and developing best-in-class and innovative analytics, reporting, and support our AI/ML Center of Excellences. This role will have responsibility for establishing and sustaining processes and practices that support Big Data, Analytics, and Reporting solutions and applications. The Data & Insight Analyst should have a passion for data, working with business people, creating solutions, and developing causal relationships that fuel a data-driven culture. This role will involve working independently and as part of a team and will focus on specific deadlines in an Agile development process as defined by the management team.
  Responsibilities: 
 
Architect and hands-on development of Analytics, Statistical Analysis, and Reporting solutions.
Implementing and configuring reporting technologies like Tableau, SuperSet, and Viola.
Proficient with SQL for databases like Oracle, PostgreSQL, and MySQL.
Proficient with Python language and Spark framework.
Architect, design, build and integrate solutions using Hadoop, OpenShift, and cloud vendors.
Redesigning existing reports and information collection processes for enhanced utility and usability.
Managing the day-to-day activities of the AI/ML Center of Excellence that’s tasked “making better decisions with data science” in Hadoop, Openshift, and cloud environments.
Drive automation capabilities into Analytics, Statistical Analysis, and Reporting solutions.
Drive development of causal relationships for business metrics and drivers.
Establish credibility and strong working relationship with development teams to review design and code for adherence to established standards and best practices.
Deliver using an Agile development process.
Maintain our repository and other relevant documentation.
Consulting skills strong enough to work with clients on their reporting needs.
Understands claims data, how data is stored in analytical platforms, and how to use and apply claims data in the validation of payment accuracy concepts and other projects.
Knowledge and ability to use Statistical methodology to solve business problems.
Ability to understand, generate, and evaluate healthcare utilization, unit cost, and medical cost trends. This includes understanding levers that affect healthcare cost, such as contracting, networks, policies, benefit structures, and product design. Ability to draw conclusions and make recommendations based on financial data.
Ability to actively and skillfully conceptualize, apply, analyze, synthesize, and/or evaluate information gathered from, or generated by, observation, experience, reflection, reasoning, or communication, as a guide to belief and action.
Ability to appropriately summarize and effectively communicate complex concepts & varied datasets to inform stakeholders, gain approval, or prompt action for multiple audiences ranging from the analyst to executive level using oral, written, and presentations.
Attention to detail and accuracy.
Desire and capacity to learn new concepts and software.
Strong analytical and problem-solving ability
Professional with ability to properly handle confidential information.
 Qualifications: 
 
 Big Data Analysis: Strong ability to manage and analyze data in a Big Data environment using a variety of scripts, potentially including but not limited to Scala/Spark and Python as well as Cloud based Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning capabilities.
 




Reasoning and Problem Solving: Ability to actively and skillfully conceptualize, apply, analyze, synthesize, and/or evaluate information gathered from, or generated by, observation, experience, reflection, reasoning, or communication, as a guide to belief and action.
 


 Consulting: Demonstrated ability to make and gain acceptance of data-driven recommendations made to business owners. Strong ability to appropriately summarize and effectively communicate complex concepts & varied data sets to inform stakeholders, gain approval, or prompt actions; Applies to multiple audiences ranging from the analyst to executive level; Includes oral & written communication and multimedia presentation.
 


 Statistical Analysis: Apply statistical methodology to solve business problems; appropriately interprets meaning from results.
 


 Business Knowledge: Good understanding of the tenets of health insurance, the managed care model, industry coding/policy standards, the claim adjudication process, and issues related to fraud waste and abuse. Ability to apply this knowledge to the development & evaluation of new initiatives and support leading the team strategy toward best practices.
 


 Financial Analysis: Ability to understand, generate and evaluate healthcare utilization, unit cost and medical cost trends. This includes understanding levers that affect healthcare cost, such as contracting, networks, policies, benefit structures, and product design. Ability to draw conclusions and make recommendations based on financial data.
 


 Functional Programming: Ability to work with, understand and create object oriented/functional programming solutions using modern application frameworks.
 




Minimum Qualifications


MS Degree in relevant discipline (Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering or Health Sciences) or a Bachelor’s degree in relevant discipline with at least 5 years of relevant experience.
2+ years of experience (or recent Masters+ graduate) in advanced analytics.
2+ years of experience (or recent Masters+ graduate) in working in Big Data environments, specifically Hadoop and cloud vendors.
2+ years of experience (or recent Masters+ graduate) in business intelligence.
2+ years of experience (or recent Masters+ graduate) with SQL, ability to write SQL queries to efficiently extract data from SQL Server/Oracle and Hive/Impala.
2+ years of experience (or recent Masters+ graduate) using Scala, Python, or R programming languages.
2+ years of experience (or recent Masters+ graduate) using distributed frameworks, such as Spark.
Ability to work independently as well as collaborate as a team.
Flexibility to work with global teams as well geographically dispersed US based teams.
Professional with ability to properly handle confidential information.
Be value-driven, understand that success is based on the impact of your work rather than its complexity or the level of effort.
Ability to handle multiple tasks and meet deadlines.
Ability to work within a matrixed organization.
Proficiency in all required skills and competencies above.


 Additional Beneficial Requirements:


Knowledge or experience of DevOps lifecycle tools like GitHub/Gitlab/BitBucket, Jenkins, Jira.
Experience or knowledge of the health insurance industry in the U.S.

Communicating with others to exchange information.

Repeating motions that may include the wrists, hands, and/or fingers.

Opportunity
Eccalon, LLC is looking for a Senior Data Analyst to support the Department of Defense?s (DOD) Office of Small Business Programs (OSBP). OSBP is responsible for the development of small business policy, oversight of DoD's small business performance for prime and subcontracting goals, administration of small business programs, industry engagement, ensuring cyber resiliency of the small business industrial base and utilization of technology and big data principles to drive market research and small business inclusion in defense procurements.
The Senior Data Analyst will provide with subject matter expertise in the overall management and performance of small business data analytics. OSBP is responsible for the analysis of federal procurement data to track small business performance towards statutory goals and to look for industries, and sectors for small business performance improvement. This includes policies and procedures for small business performance management across the DoD, supporting the establishment of small business goals for the defense agencies, utilizing tools and technologies for performance management and data analysis of small business contracting information for prime and sub-contract awards. Contractor shares this analysis through weekly reports on small business performance and ad hoc reports as needed on areas for small business improvements and recent contract awards.
Responsibilities:

Produce reports using the federal procurement data system (FPDS) and other data systems to assess small business performance with approximately one report per week.
Develop and implement a methodology to query and analyze contracting data in FPDS-NG, SAMS.GOV, eSRS and other data systems to provide data visualizations, reports, and other written products that describe small business performance and metrics.
Produce weekly reports on small business metrics in contracting to better monitor DoD?s execution of small business utilization goals with approximately one report per week.
Utilize market research tools to identify and ad hoc reports on opportunities to better utilize small businesses within the defense industrial base with approximately five reports per month.
Draft responses to requests for data on specific Defense programs, defense industry sectors, or critical technology sectors utilizing FPDS-NG, SAMS.GOV, eSRS and other data systems to better understand small business performance, with approximately two reports per week.

Required Qualifications:

Eligible for SECRET security clearance.
Bachelor's degree in Political Science and Government, Public Relations, Public Policy, International Relations and Affairs, English, Communication, or any other related field.
5+ years of demonstrated competence in public policy programming and coordination.
5+ years of successfully leading Data Analytics, Business Intelligence, Database Management, and/or a combination of all three in a corporate or government setting
Expertise in communicating complex data insights for those without a data background
Deep knowledge of and demonstrated experience with Data Analysis 
   
Prior experience with Salesforce,
Prior ETL experience; and
Experience with one or more data visualization tools, such as Tableau, Domo, Google Analytics, Power BI, etc.
Experience with Airtable, Smartsheets, relational databases / DBMS and related programming languages, such as SQL, R, and Python a plus.

Possess at least an earned B.A./B.S. degree in Computer Science, MIS, Statistics, or other field related to data analysis from a regionally accredited institution of higher education (or international equivalent)
Foresight, maturity, and the ability to present thoughtful and data-led solutions to complex problems
Strong interpersonal communications skills, including oral and written skills
Strong analytical skills
Synthesize complex issues into audience-appropriate policy considerations and recommendations.
Ability to develop and maintain contacts and interact with members of Congress and their congressional staff to proactively advance OSBP priorities.
Excellent oral and written communication skills, including the ability to describe laws and the legislative process.
Working knowledge of Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, and Excel.
A willingness and aptitude to operate successfully as a part of a team that is distributed geographically
Demonstrated experience leading a team or teams (Preferred)

Experience teaching an organization to become more data-driven (Preferred)

THE COMPANY


  KRAFTON is dedicated to identifying and publishing games worldwide that offer a uniquely enjoyable experience, crafted by our globally recognized production studios known for their distinctive creativity. We continuously push the boundaries of gaming enjoyment by embracing new challenges and technologies and expanding our platforms and services to captivate an even larger fan base. Best known for the genre-defining worldwide sensation PUBG: Battlegrounds, our stellar studios based across the globe include PUBG Studios, Striking Distance Studios, Unknown Worlds, Bluehole Studio, RisingWings and more. In collaboration with our passionate and driven team, we strive to establish ourselves as a renowned creator of masterpieces in the global gaming market.
 



THE OPPORTUNITY


   We are seeking a Senior Data Analyst with over 7 years of experience in data analytics, business intelligence, and reporting. The ideal candidate will lead comprehensive data analysis projects, collaborate with senior stakeholders, and develop advanced analytics solutions that support strategic decision-making. They will be responsible for mentoring a team of analysts, driving process improvements, and ensuring data quality and integrity. Additionally, this role will involve building high-impact dashboards, leveraging data mining techniques to uncover trends, and presenting actionable insights to senior leadership to inform business strategies.
  

 RESPONSIBILITIES



    Lead comprehensive data analysis projects, managing the entire process from data extraction to advanced statistical modeling and insightful reporting.
   

    Collaborate with senior stakeholders to define strategic business questions and deliver actionable insights that inform key business decisions.
   

    Develop and optimize high-impact dashboards that monitor key performance indicators and provide clear visibility into business health.
   

    Leverage advanced data mining techniques to uncover trends and forecast business opportunities that support strategic decision-making.
   

    Mentor and guide a team of analysts, fostering a culture of continuous learning, technical growth, and excellence.
   

    Drive process improvements and automation within the analytics pipeline, increasing efficiency and scalability.
   

    Present complex data insights to senior leadership, offering clear recommendations that shape strategic initiatives.
   

    Collaborate with IT and data engineering teams to ensure an optimized data infrastructure for efficient access and analysis.
   


QUALIFICATIONS



    7+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a related field, with a proven ability to lead data-driven initiatives.
   

    Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Data Science, or a related discipline, with a commitment to continuous learning and staying up-to-date with industry trends.
   

    Expertise in SQL for extracting, manipulating, and analyzing large, complex datasets, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
   

    Proficiency in data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or equivalent platforms, with a demonstrated ability to create intuitive and actionable dashboards.
   

    Strong understanding of statistical methods, including data modeling, forecasting, and predictive analytics, with practical experience applying these techniques to business problems.
   

    Ability to translate complex business requirements into clear, actionable insights that inform strategic decisions.
   

    Excellent communication skills, with the capacity to present data-driven insights to both technical and non-technical audiences effectively.
   

    Proven organizational and project management skills, with a track record of successfully managing multiple concurrent projects.
   


PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS



    Experience working in global companies or gaming companies.
   

    Experience with cloud-based data platforms (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud, Azure) or big data technologies, with a focus on optimizing data access and infrastructure for analytics.
   

    Knowledge of machine learning or AI applications in data analytics.
   

    Familiarity with Python or R for data analysis and automation.
   

    Experience contributing to company-wide data strategies.
   

    Proficiency in Korean to effectively communicate with teams and stakeholders in Korea.
   



 Don’t meet every single requirement?


   Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply at jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At Krafton we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You might just be the right candidate for this or other roles.

 KRAFTON Americas is committed to the full inclusion of all qualified individuals. If reasonable accommodation is needed to apply for an open position, perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact the HR Talent team at KRAFTON Americas, to begin the interactive process.
